text:
I got a SVG whose size is about 714ko (75ko in SVGZ) and I just can't open it 
with squiggle. It works perfectly with Corel viewer and partially with adobe 
viewer.
creator: multitrash@noos.fr

text: Give squiggle additional memory (using the -Xmx  command line option).
creator: deweese@apache.org

text:
I used :
java -Xmx500mb -Xms100mb -jar batik-squiggle.jar 
for my less than 1mb SVG but it still fails. One part of my SVG is well 
rendered (about 1% of my SVG) and the rest of it is completely ignored.
However in the DOM viewer everything is fine...
My SVG is not complex but its width is huge (more than 5 meters at scale 1:1), 
it is a genealogic tree.
creator: multitrash@noos.fr
deweese@apache.org
text:
You need to have a viewBox attribute otherwise Squiggle uses
a default 400x400 viewBox.  Content without a correct viewBox
is a common mistake.

   I think this will fix your problems.
